free_text.Bibliography and material: Various technical papers in English language
free_text.Content: The course contains 4 main subject areas:[br/][br/]1) Basic models and algorithms for individual agents:[br/]game-playing algorithms, reactive agents and reinforcement learning. Models and algorithms for rational, goal-oriented behavior in agents.[br/]2) Multi-agent systems: [br/]multi-agent planning, distributed algorithms for constraint satisfaction, coordination techniques for multi-agent systems.[br/]3) Self-interested agents:[br/]Models and algorithms for implementing self-interested agents motivated by economic principles: elements of computational game theory, models and algorithms for automated negotiation, social choice, mechanism design, electronic auctions and marketplaces.[br/]4) Implementing multi-agent systems:[br/]Agent platforms, ontologies and markup languages, web services and standards for their definition and indexing.[br/]
free_text.Learning outcomes: This course teaches students the main technologies for implementing intelligent agents and multi-agent systems are well as their underlying theories.

en.title: Intelligent Agents
en.library_recommends:
• "An introduction to multiagent systems / Michael Woolridge". Year:2009. ISBN:978-0-470-51946-2
  • "Artificial intelligence : a modern approach / Stuart J. Russell and Peter Norvig ; contributing writers: Ernest Davis ... [et al.]". Year:2010. ISBN:978-0-13-207148-2

free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: Michael Wooldridge : An Introduction to MultiAgent Systems - Second Edition, John Wiley & Sons, 2009[br/]Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (2nd/3rd Edition), Prentice Hall Series in Artificial Intelligence, 2003/2009.[br/]
free_text.Forme d'enseignement: Ex cathedra, travaux pratiques sur ordinateur
free_text.Contenu: Le cours traite 4 thèmes principaux:[br/][br/]1) Agents simples:[br/]Algorithmes pour des programmes de jeux, agents réactifs, reinforcement learning, planification automatique.[br/]2) Systèmes multi-agents : planification multi-agent, algorithmes distribués pour la satisfaction de contraintes, coordination d'agents.[br/]4) Agents économiques:[br/]Modèles et algorithmes pour l implémentation d agents motivés par des principes économiques [br/]théorie des jeux, principes de la négociation, choix de groupes, conception de mécanismes économiques, économies électroniques.[br/]4) Implémentation de systèmes multi-agents:[br/]Plateformes d'agents, utilisation d'ontologies, standards pour les web services.[br/][br/]
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: L'objectif de ce cours est d'apprendre les technologies pour l'implémentation d'agents intelligents et de systèmes multi-agents ainsi que les théories sous-jacentes.

fr.title: Intelligent Agents
fr.library_recommends:

  • "Artificial intelligence : a modern approach / Stuart J. Russell and Peter Norvig ; contributing writers: Ernest Davis ... [et al.]". Année:2010. ISBN:978-0-13-207148-2
